drug_classes.title: Anticoagulants / antiplatelets
drug_classes.label: Anticoagulants / antiplatelets
drug_classes.definition: Context bucket for peptides that may plausibly influence bleeding/clotting balance, platelet function, or vascular repair in a way that could matter alongside anticoagulant or antiplatelet medications.
tagging_rules: Use when bleeding/clotting pathways are meaningfully implicated.
Do not imply a proven clinical interaction; this is a cautionary context flag.

drug_classes.title: Antihypertensives / BP-lowering agents
drug_classes.notes: Blood pressure effects and orthostatic risk context.
drug_classes.label: Antihypertensives
drug_classes.definition: Context bucket for peptides that may influence blood pressure or vascular resistance in a way that could matter alongside antihypertensive medications.
tagging_rules: Use when BP modulation is plausible and non-trivial.

drug_classes.title: Glucose-lowering agents
drug_classes.notes: Hypoglycemia risk context; appetite/gastric effects context.
drug_classes.label: Diabetes / glucose lowering
drug_classes.definition: Context bucket for peptides that influence glucose regulation, insulin sensitivity, or glycemic control in a way that could matter alongside diabetes therapies.
tagging_rules: Use when glycemic effects are relevant, especially outside GLP-1/incretin-specific mechanisms.

drug_classes.title: Immunosuppressants / immune-modulating drugs
drug_classes.label: Immunosuppressants
drug_classes.definition: Context bucket for peptides that meaningfully modulate immune signaling or immune cell activity in a way that could matter alongside immunosuppressive therapies.
tagging_rules: Use when immune modulation is central (not vague “immune support”).

drug_classes.title: Corticosteroids
drug_classes.label: Corticosteroids
drug_classes.definition: Context bucket for peptides that modulate inflammatory or immune pathways that could overlap with, or be affected by, corticosteroid use.
tagging_rules: Use when immune/inflammatory modulation is a core feature.

drug_classes.title: Antidiabetics (Insulin/GLP-1 and related)
drug_classes.notes: Routing/labeling class for diabetes medications (incretin/GLP-1 class, insulin and related). Educational only.
drug_classes.label: Antidiabetics (insulin/GLP-1 axis)
drug_classes.definition: Bucket for peptides primarily acting on insulin secretion, incretin/GLP-1 signaling, or closely related glucose-control mechanisms.
tagging_rules: Use when insulin/GLP-1/incretin mechanisms are central.

drug_classes.title: NSAIDs (ibuprofen/naproxen and related)
drug_classes.notes: Routing/labeling class for nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs. Educational only.
drug_classes.label: NSAIDs
drug_classes.definition: Context bucket for peptides whose primary effects overlap with inflammation signaling, tissue repair, or pathways commonly affected by NSAIDs.
tagging_rules: Use when inflammation modulation or tissue repair is central to the peptide’s effects.
Avoid if overlap is incidental or purely speculative.

drug_classes.title: SSRIs/SNRIs and other serotonergic agents
drug_classes.notes: Routing/labeling class for serotonergic antidepressants and agents. Educational only.
drug_classes.label: SSRIs/SNRIs (serotonergic)
drug_classes.definition: Context bucket for peptides that influence serotonergic signaling or CNS pathways in a way that could matter alongside SSRIs, SNRIs, or other serotonergic agents.
tagging_rules: Use when serotonergic overlap is plausible and relevant to the peptide’s effects.

drug_classes.title: Anti-infectives / antimicrobials (antibiotics, antivirals, antifungals)
drug_classes.notes: Routing/labeling class for anti-infective medications. Educational only.
drug_classes.label: Anti-infectives / antimicrobials
drug_classes.definition: Narrow bucket for peptides with direct, widely accepted antimicrobial/anti-infective activity against pathogens (not just indirect immune modulation).
tagging_rules: Use only when direct pathogen-targeting activity is central and broadly supported.
Do not use for indirect immune effects or general immune modulation.

drug_classes.title: Immune modulation / infection risk context
drug_classes.notes: Educational grouping for peptides that frequently appear in immune/infection discussions. Not a medication class.
drug_classes.label: Immune modulation / infection risk
drug_classes.definition: Context bucket for peptides that alter immune signaling or inflammatory balance in a way that could affect infection susceptibility or immune surveillance. This does not imply antimicrobial action.
tagging_rules: Use for meaningful immune modulation where infection risk is a reasonable consideration.
Do not use to imply direct antimicrobial effects.

drug_classes.title: Cardiovascular physiology / vasoactive peptide context
drug_classes.notes: Educational context grouping for endogenous or peptide-like agents involved in cardiovascular regulation (BP, volume, vascular tone). Not a medication class.
drug_classes.label: Cardiovascular physiology (context)
drug_classes.definition: Bucket for peptides meaningfully involved in vascular tone, blood pressure regulation, cardiac signaling, or cardiovascular physiology.
tagging_rules: Use when BP/vascular tone/cardiac signaling is meaningfully involved.

drug_classes.title: Endocrine axis modulation (HPT/HPA/HPG/GH context)
drug_classes.notes: Educational grouping for peptides/hormones that directly influence endocrine axes. Not a medication class.
drug_classes.label: Endocrine axis modulation (context)
drug_classes.definition: Bucket for peptides that influence hormonal signaling and endocrine feedback loops (e.g., HPG/HPA/GH axes) in a way that can affect interpretation or interactions with hormone-based therapies.
tagging_rules: Use when axis-level hormonal signaling or feedback is involved.

drug_classes.title: Neuropeptides / CNS signaling (context)
drug_classes.notes: Educational grouping for endogenous peptides with prominent CNS signaling roles. Not a medication class.
drug_classes.label: Neuropeptide (CNS context)
drug_classes.definition: Bucket for peptides acting primarily within neuropeptide/CNS signaling networks (e.g., mood, cognition, arousal, autonomic signaling).
tagging_rules: Use when CNS/neuropeptide signaling is a primary mechanism/effect domain.
